column2: 'Business Inputs' refers to the materials and resources that the company depends upon.
No business can be sustainable if its success relies on using inputs which are damaging to society or the environment to obtain.

column6: Energy is from renewable sources
Water use is environmentally responsible and socially equitable
Natural resources are managed to respect the welfare of ecosystems, people and animals
Procurement safeguards the pursuit of future-fitness

column2: 'Operational Activities' refers to the business processes of the company itself.
To be sustainable, a company must be accountable for eliminating any negative environmental and social impacts caused by its own activities.

column6: Operational emissions do not harm people or the environment
Operations emit no greenhouse gases
Operational waste is eliminated
Operations do not encroach on ecosystems or communities

column2: Employees' refers to the people that work directly for the company (as opposed to workers of independent, arm's-length suppliers).
To be sustainable, a company must ensure its employees have what they need to cover the basic needs of themselves and their families, and are given support to help them work responsibly.

column6: Employee health is safeguarded
Employees are paid at least a living wage
Employees are subject to fair employment terms
Employees are not subject to discrimination
Employee concerns are actively solicited, impartially judged and transparently addressed
Business is conducted ethically

column2: 'Products' refers to the revenue-generating goods and services offered by a company.
To be sustainable, a company must do all it can to ensure that the goods and services it offers do not harm people or the environment - particularly the people who purchase and use them.

column6: Product communications are honest, ethical, and promote responsible use
Product concerns are actively solicited, impartially judged and transparently addressed
Products do not harm people or the environment
Products emit no greenhouse gases
Products can be repurposed

column2: Corporate Citizenship' refers to how the company supports, benefits from, and interacts with the society it operates in.
A company must behave ethically, and must in no way undermine the integrity of the societal institutions and physical infrastructure we all rely on.

column6: Community health is safeguarded
The right tax is paid in the right place at the right time
Lobbying and advocacy safeguard the pursuit of future-fitness
Financial assets safeguard the pursuit of future-fitness
